Sentencas: CH4-CO2 fueled solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are the high-efficiency and low-carbon power generation technology.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: However, carbon deposition severely hinders its application.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Here, the numerical model considering the complex anode CH4 internal reforming reactions, H2 electrochemical reaction, gas diffusion and charge transfer of SOFC using CH4-CO2 fuel has been established.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The CH4-CO2 internal reforming and electrochemical reactions of SOFC under different CO2/CH4 ratios and temperatures are studied to reveal the optimal operating conditions.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The distributions of different reaction rates, gas components and carbon deposition activity at the anode are analyzed.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results show that the increase of CO2 concentration can decrease the carbon activity but also cause the decrease of electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It is found that the good comprehensive performances including power density, carbon activity and methane conversion rate can be achieved under the CO2/CH4 molar ratio of 1.
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The thermodynamic calculation of three different methane reforming modes shows that CH4-CO2 reforming leads to the greatest carbon deposition risk compared with CH4-H2O and CH4-O2 reforming, implying the importance of anti-carbon for CH4-CO2 fueled SOFC.(c) 2023
Titulo: Numerical study on effects of CH4-CO2 internal reforming on electrochemical performance and carbon deposition of solid oxide fuel cell
